 12 -def _set_gl_color(color): 

 13      """Convenience function for setting the GL color to a 3- or 4-tuple.""" 
 14      if len(color) == 3: 
 15          gl.glColor3f(*color) 
 16      if len(color) == 4: 
 17          gl.glColor4f(*color)

 20 -def rect(color, corner, size, width=0): 

 21      """Draw a rectangle 
 22   
 23      :Parameters: 
 24          `color` : tuple 
 25              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
 26          `corner` : tuple 
 27              The co-ordinates of the top-left corner of the rectangle 
 28          `size` : tuple 
 29              A tuple of (width, height) for the rectangle 
 30          `width` : float 
 31              The line width for the rectangle. If zero, rectangle is filled. 
 32              Defaults to zero. 
 33   
 34      """ 
 35      _set_gl_color(color) 
 36      if width: 
 37          gl.glLineWidth(width) 
 38          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_LOOP) 
 39      else: 
 40          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_QUADS) 
 41      gl.glVertex2f(*corner) 
 42      gl.glVertex2f(corner[0], corner[1] + size[1]) 
 43      gl.glVertex2f(corner[0] + size[0], corner[1] + size[1]) 
 44      gl.glVertex2f(corner[0] + size[0], corner[1]) 
 45      gl.glEnd() 

 46   
 47   

 48 -def polygon(color, pointlist, width=0): 

 49      """Draw a closed polygon 
 50   
 51      :Parameters: 
 52          `color` : tuple 
 53              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
 54          `pointlist` : list 
 55              An list of (x,y) tuples for vertices of the polygon 
 56          `width` : float 
 57              The line width for the polygon. If zero, polygon is filled. 
 58              Defaults to zero. 
 59   
 60      """ 
 61      _set_gl_color(color) 
 62      if width: 
 63          gl.glLineWidth(width) 
 64          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_LOOP) 
 65      else: 
 66          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_POLYGON) 
 67      for p in pointlist: 
 68          gl.glVertex2f(*p) 
 69      gl.glEnd() 

 70   

 71 -def regular_polygon(color, center, radius, points, orbits=1, width=0): 

 72      """Draw a regular polygon 
 73       
 74      :Parameters: 
 75          `color` : tuple 
 76              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
 77          `center` : tuple 
 78              The co-ordinates of the center of the polygon 
 79          `radius` : float 
 80              The circumradius of the polygon 
 81          `points` : int 
 82              The number of vertices of the polygon 
 83          `orbits` : int 
 84              The number of times the polygon repeats back on itself. Values 
 85              greater than one yield star shapes. Defaults to one. 
 86          `width` : float 
 87              The line width for the polygon. If zero, polygon is filled. 
 88              Defaults to zero. 
 89      """ 
 90      theta = (2 * math.pi * orbits)/points 
 91      pointlist = [(center[0] + radius * math.cos(n * theta),  
 92                    center[1] + radius * math.sin(n * theta))  
 93                    for n in range(points)] 
 94      polygon(color, pointlist, width) 

 95   

 96 -def circle(color, center, radius, width=0, npoints=24): 

 97      """Draw a circle 
 98   
 99      :Parameters: 
100          `color` : tuple 
101              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
102          `center` : tuple 
103              The co-ordinates of the center of the circle 
104          `radius` : float 
105              The radius of the circle 
106          `width` : float 
107              The line width for the circle. If zero, circle is filled. 
108              Defaults to zero. 
109          `npoints` : int 
110              The number of vertices on the circumference of the circle. 
111              Defaults to 24. 
112   
113      """ 
114      _set_gl_color(color) 
115      if width: 
116          gl.glLineWidth(width) 
117          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_LOOP) 
118      else: 
119          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_POLYGON) 
120      for i in xrange(npoints): 
121          theta = i * math.pi * 2 / npoints 
122          gl.glVertex2f(center[0] + radius * math.cos(theta), 
123                     center[1] + radius * math.sin(theta)) 
124      gl.glEnd() 

125   
126   

127 -def ellipse(color, corner, size, width=0, npoints=24): 

128      """Draw an axis-aligned ellipse 
129   
130      :Parameters: 
131          `color` : tuple 
132              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
133          `corner` : tuple 
134              The co-ordinates of the top-left corner of the ellipse's 
135              enclosing rectangle 
136          `size` : tuple 
137              A tuple of (width, height) for the ellipse 
138          `width` : float 
139              The line width for the ellipse. If zero, ellipse is filled. 
140              Defaults to zero. 
141          `npoints` : int 
142              The number of vertices on the circumference of the ellipse. 
143              Defaults to 24. 
144   
145      """ 
146      _set_gl_color(color) 
147      center = (corner[0] + .5 * size[0], corner[1] + .5 * size[1]) 
148      if width: 
149          gl.glLineWidth(width) 
150          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_LOOP) 
151      else: 
152          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_POLYGON) 
153      for i in xrange(npoints): 
154          theta = i * math.pi * 2 / npoints 
155          gl.glVertex2f(center[0] + .5 * size[0] * math.cos(theta), 
156                     center[1] + .5 * size[1] * math.sin(theta)) 
157      gl.glEnd() 

158   
159   

160 -def arc(color, corner, size, start_angle, stop_angle, width=1, npoints=24): 

161      """Draw an arc of an axis-aligned ellipse 
162   
163      :Parameters: 
164          `color` : tuple 
165              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
166          `corner` : tuple 
167              The co-ordinates of the top-left corner of the ellipse's 
168              enclosing rectangle 
169          `size` : tuple 
170              A tuple of (width, height) for the ellipse 
171          `start_angle` : float 
172              The start angle of the arc, in radians, counterclockwise from the 
173              positive x-axis 
174          `stop_angle` : float 
175              The start angle of the arc, in radians, counterclockwise from the 
176              positive x-axis 
177          `width` : float 
178              The line width for the ellipse. Defaults to 1.0 
179          `npoints` : int 
180              The number of vertices on the circumference of the ellipse. 
181              Defaults to 24. 
182   
183      """ 
184      _set_gl_color(color) 
185      center = (corner[0] + .5 * size[0], corner[1] + .5 * size[1]) 
186      gl.glLineWidth(width) 
187      gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_STRIP) 
188      for i in range(npoints + 1): 
189          theta = start_angle + (float(i * (stop_angle - start_angle)) / npoints) 
190          gl.glVertex2f(center[0] + .5 * size[0] * math.cos(theta), 
191                     center[1] + .5 * size[1] * math.sin(theta)) 
192      gl.glEnd() 

193

195 -def line(color, start, end, width=1): 

196      """Draw a line segment 
197   
198      :Parameters: 
199          `color` : tuple 
200              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
201          `start` : tuple 
202              The co-ordinates of the start point of the line segment 
203          `end` : tuple 
204              The co-ordinates of the end point of the line segment 
205          `width` : float 
206              The line width. Defaults to 1.0 
207   
208      """ 
209      _set_gl_color(color) 
210      gl.glLineWidth(width) 
211      gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINES) 
212      gl.glVertex2f(*start) 
213      gl.glVertex2f(*end) 
214      gl.glEnd() 

215   

216 -def lines(color, closed, pointlist, width=1): 

217      """Draw a sequence of linked line segments 
218   
219      :Parameters: 
220          `color` : tuple 
221              The colour to use, as a 3- or 4-tuple of floats 
222          `closed` : bool 
223              If true, the start and end points are joined by an extra segment. 
224          `pointlist` : list 
225              A list of (x,y) tuples for the endpoints of the segments. 
226          `width` : float 
227              The line width. Defaults to 1.0 
228   
229      """ 
230      _set_gl_color(color) 
231      gl.glLineWidth(width) 
232      if closed: 
233          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_LOOP) 
234      else: 
235          gl.glBegin(gl.GL_LINE_STRIP) 
236      for p in pointlist: 
237          gl.glVertex2f(*p) 
238      gl.glEnd()
